instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PLT_RST_L: What is PLT_RST_L? This is an abbreviation of “PLT_RESET_L” – when you see “PLT_RST_L", assume the person meant to type PLT_RESET_L.
definitions.PM_SYSRST_L: What is PM_SYSRST_L? PM_SYSRST_L is a system reset signal present when it is low, _L means the signal asserts itself when the voltage is low. This signal needs to be high for the system to exit reset mode & turn on properly. .
definitions.SMC_LRESET_L: What is SMC_LRESET_L? SMC_LRESET_L is a typo of SMC_RESET_L. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Not powering on
threads.message:
Hi Rossmann's repair group crew,

Here is the behavior of the board : when I plug the charger, it ramp to 20V 150mA, stay there for 10 sec, then 20V 0A for a few seconds, and finally goes back to 20V 150mA and stay there. There is obviously no image, no CPU activity, just the fan spin for 3-4 seconds at the beginning. After a close inspection, I can tell there is no presence of liquid and it seems there is no apparent damage on component.

Main S5, S4 and S0 rails are present. 
However <SIGNAL>PPVCCCPU_S0G</SIGNAL> is missing (6omhs to ground, same as a good working board). <CHIP>U7210</CHIP> and <CHIP>U7220</CHIP> are well supplied by <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>CPUVR_PWM</SIGNAL> are presents (2.5V), but <SIGNAL>CPUVR_FCCM</SIGNAL> are not. I don't know what FCCM means, but on the <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> where it comes from, schematics says it's critical. So maybe a problem with <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>. 

<CHIP>U7100</CHIP> looks brand new, well supplied by <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>. Also, <SIGNAL>PM_EN_CPUVCC_R</SIGNAL> = 3,2V. I have no clue how this <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> works and what to mesure...

I also have noticed some SMC rails are missing. Here is what I mesured for main SMC rails :
- <SIGNAL>SMC_LRESET_L</SIGNAL> = 0V ---> <SIGNAL>PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL> = 0V too
- <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
- <SIGNAL>PM_SYSRST_L</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
- <SIGNAL>SMC_RST_BTN_L</SIGNAL> = 0V

I have tried to clean the ME Region with Medusa, no change.
Thank you to everyone who will take time to read this thread, and help me to sort this out ! Bye ;)

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Not powering on
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> MUST be high!
But  <SIGNAL>PPVCCCPU_S0G</SIGNAL> must appear first.
Do you get <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Not powering on
